intro: Blepharispermum yemense, commonly known as the Yemen sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
